attributes.action: A Public Inquiry into the Management and Governance of the UK's Universities
attributes.background: 2017/18 saw the longest university strike ever, over slashed pensions. Students lost classes,  staff  pay.  An independent Joint Expert Panel has found small tweaks, as suggested by staff, would save the pension scheme. The strike was only due to university bosses' insistence on confrontation.
attributes.additional_details:
UK university Vice Chancellors get mega-salaries.  Many unis now employ more administrators and managers than lecturers and researchers.  There is a massive secret network of lobby groups/ consultancies.  This superstructure is all funded by the debt enforced on our children as student loans, and taxpayer’s money. Yet the expert panel's findings suggest it is not up to the job.

A Public Inquiry is need to restore good teaching and research for the public good in Britain's Universities.

attributes.action: Include black role models as part of history education throughout the year.
attributes.background: Black history is not a compulsory part of UK education – we are asking the government to look at the positive impact of including important black role models as part of history education throughout the academic year.

attributes.action: Remove prescription fees for those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: From our experience, many people suffering with mental health issues need a number of prescriptions, which are expensive. In particular those with bipolar have difficulty managing their money - it’s part of the illness. Bipolar is life threatening - their prescription should be free.

attributes.action: Provide bereavement benefits for unmarried partners of 10 years or more.
attributes.background: Shawn and I were together for 26 years. He died on 31st March. It is unfair that bereavement allowances and payments are only for married couples and civil partners.
attributes.additional_details: People who are in a relationship for many years share the same costs and have the same financial responsibilities as married or civilly partnered people. They may have joint bank accounts and mortgages. They need the same rights to assistance when they lose their life partner.

attributes.action: Tax manufacturers and suppliers distributing Single Use Plastics beyond 2020
attributes.background: Following the success of documentaries such as Blue Planet, it has become clearer the deadly state single use plastics has on our environment. The government should look at taxing the problem at source to encourage companies to research breakthrough in sustainable, biodegradable alternatives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.plasticfreechallenge.org/what-is-single-use-plastic/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-45232167

https://ieep.eu/archive_uploads/2128/IEEP_ACES_Product_Fiche_Single_Use_Plastics_Final_October_2016.pdf

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.radiotimes.com/news/tv/2018-08-29/blue-planet-2-plastic-waste-final-episode/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/abcnews.go.com/amp/International/great-pacific-garbage-patch-massive-floating-island-plastic/story%3fid=53962147

attributes.action: Review current policy allowing councils to turn off street lights at night.
attributes.background:
As police numbers fall and crime rates rise it is causing a feeling of insecurity amongst local communities as many councils turn off ALL ‘non essential’ street lights. 
We feel that street lights are needed for the well being of our community

attributes.action: Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field to be used when selling bicycles on web sites.
attributes.background: Many stolen bicycles are sold on second hand web sites. It is almost impossible to identify bikes on these sites. Therefore a Mandatory FRAME NUMBER field must be filled in when selling bicycles on these sites, without the number being given the item cant be advertised e.g. Ebay Gumtree etc.

attributes.action: Take greater action to improve young people's mental health in the UK
attributes.background: More than 100,000 14-year-olds in the UK self-harm. We the undersigned call for Parliament to respond by adopting new Children's Society guidelines (such as requiring a counsellor in every secondary school) so all young people can access the support for their mental health they need.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/sites/default/files/good_childhood_summary_2018.pdf
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-45329030
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/aug/29/quarter-of-14-year-old-girls-in-uk-have-self-harmed-report-finds

attributes.action: Make It Law That Cyclists Have To Have Insurance
attributes.background: Cyclists can cause accidents just like other road users! They have very little patience towards people that they share both cycle and footpaths with. They should be insured!

attributes.action: Make the A1 junction with the A46 at Newark in Nottinghamshire safe.
attributes.background:
The A1 at Newark is a very busy. 
There are regular fatal accidents on this section of the road. Specifically where the A1 meets the A46 and A17. Both slip roads on North and South are too short. The slip roads need to be longer or traffic lights putting on each roundabout either side.
attributes.additional_details: Our local MP has acknowledged this issue in the past but nothing seems to have been done as yet.

attributes.action: Change adultery for grounds of divorce to apply to same-sex affairs
attributes.background: According to current UK law, you cannot divorce someone on grounds of adultery if it's a same-sex affair. This technically means that you don't legally commit adultery if you cheat on your partner with someone of the same sex- even if you are in a same-sex marriage. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: In order for heterosexual and homosexual couples to have completely equal rights, the UK law needs to change urgently.

attributes.action: Make a crime that is motivated by prejudice against homelessness a hate crime.
attributes.background: Homeless people are some of the most vulnerable members of society, but face the risk of physical and verbal attacks by members of the public daily. Homeless people are at risk of having their possessions stolen and subjected to emotional abuse just because they live in absolute poverty.
attributes.additional_details: These are people who are discriminated against because they are affected by poverty. They should be protected by the same laws that protect people from other kinds of hate crimes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to carry any knife in public without good reason.
attributes.background: A knife point can cause serious injury or kill at a depth of just 2cm . Therefore why is it legal to carry a knife that has a folding blade with a cutting edge 3 inches long or less. No knife should be carried on UK streets.

attributes.action: Ban all new fossil fuel vehicles by 2030
attributes.background: The UK Government has committed to banning new diesel and petrol cars by 2040. This is too late. The Clean Growth Strategy and legally binding carbon budgets require policies & action on major emitters and transport is now the largest contributing sector to UK emissions and causes air pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/mar/18/uk-should-bring-2040-petrol-and-diesel-car-ban-forward-2030-green-alliance

https://www.theccc.org.uk/2018/01/17/uks-ambitious-clean-growth-strategy-must-translated-urgently-action/

http://www.green-alliance.org.uk/resources/How_the_UK_can_lead_the_electric_vehicle_revolution.pdf

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-40723581

attributes.action: Make all marketing of processed meats aimed at children illegal
attributes.background: With evidence now showing processed meats to be a group one carcinogen; meaning they are known to cause cancer, we cannot stand by and allow companies to profit from these products by marketing them to our children at the cost of their health.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lanonc/article/PIIS1470-2045(15)00444-1/abstract

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/06/24/superman-batman-wonder-woman-recruited-food-giant-bid-counteract/amp/

attributes.action: Freeze rail fares across British service providers in January 2019
attributes.background: This petition asks the Government to commit to a "fares freeze" for regulated fares next year, as rail fares are expected to increase by 3.2% in 2019.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite the lack of service improvements, failure to deliver compensation, the disruption caused by new timetables, consumers are still being told that fare increases are justified.

National Punctuality (PPM) in Q4 of 2017 was recorded at 86.4%, indicating a decline of 27pp compared to 2016-17. (Source: orr.gov.uk)

National Reliability (CaSL) in Q4 of 2017 was 4.8%, which also indicates a drop in quality of service and a decrease of 1.4pp compared to 2016-17. (Source: orr.gov.uk)

The ORR also discovered that 59% of consumers that made complaints to National Rail providers in 2017-18 were dissatisfied with the outcome of their complaint.

This petition proposes that all regulated train fares are frozen in January 2019.

attributes.action: Utilise Highways England to reconstruct our potholed minor roads.
attributes.background: I propose that we utilise the skills of Highways England to manage the reconstruction of our potholed and increasingly dangerous minor roads. Funding to be provided by reallocating some funds from the Strategic Road Network budget. We need to stop further deterioration of our roads and rebuild.
attributes.additional_details:
Highways England manages our Strategic Road Network that includes most motorways and significant ‘A’ roads. This covers only 2% of our total road network and yet accounts for a third of all travelled miles. However, £21.6 billion was spent on the SRN last year whilst only £1.8 billion was granted to the minor road network.

We need to temporarily redress this financial imbalance to rebuild our local roads to ensure that the ‘first and last mile’ of our journeys are improved to a safe standard.

attributes.action: Make students in the uk pay council tax in the city that they study and live.
attributes.background:
Students in Brighton and hove, that number in the thousands use all the resources that the residents use yet pay 0% council tax, this is wrong on every level, 
The residents are forced to pay increases year on year because resources are overused and  Underfinanced, students Must contribute.

attributes.action: Make food and drink labelling more specific when stating may contain nuts
attributes.background: So many packaging contains the phrase “may contain nuts”. This needs to be more specific as someone with a peanut allergy may not have an allergy to any other nuts but won’t buy the product because it’s not specific enough even though this particular nut may not be present.
attributes.additional_details: most manufacturers use the term “may contain nuts” for example brands such as Cadbury, Kellogg’s, Peters pies the list goes on. The labelling has been seen on yoghurt, cereals, baked goods and even bread. People with a certain nut allergy should be able to look at the packaging and see what nuts could be present so that they’re not excluded from all nuts that they are able to consume

attributes.action: Stop sending our Foreign aid money to countries with no animal rights
attributes.background: We give huge sums of our taxes to countries like China, Vietnam, Pakistan etc where animals both domestic and farmed are given no protection whatsoever from abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Countless petitions to these Governments pleading to stop atrocities like Yulin Dog Eating 'Festival' or Vietnamese slaughtering cattle with a sledgehammer seem to fall on deaf ears. I propose we stop our taxes being donated as foreign aid to these countries and I believe that 'money talks' so perhaps they will listen!
Sign and share please, let's see where this goes!

attributes.action: Make public, communal eating space a legal requirement in high density housing.
attributes.background: A study found that regularly eating meals alone is the biggest single factor for unhappiness, besides existing mental illness. When we only design commercial spaces for individualised food consumption and cooking spaces for the single person, we are designing unhappiness.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it should be a legal requirement for housing developments of any significant density, to provide large social eating spaces and communal kitchens, in which inhabitants can cook for one another, socialise and share food freely. This will avoid public health concerns such as social isolation.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/23/the-friend-effect-why-the-secret-of-health-and-happiness-is-surprisingly-simple
 
foodhallproject.org

attributes.action: Make 29th March a National Bank Holiday - Called Independence Day!
attributes.background: On the 29th March the UK will officially leave the European Union - This should be celebrated nationally with a bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: After many decades being controlled through multiple European Union institutions, being unable to control our own trading policy, immigration system, waters and laws. On the 23rd June 2016, the United Kingdom voted to become a self governing country again - This will finally start to happen on March 29th 2019 - And it should therefore be celebrated.

attributes.action: If there is a vote on the final EU deal then there must be no option to stay in
attributes.background: If there is a referendum on the final deal with the EU then the options must be simply deal or no deal. There must be no option to stay a member of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: It was clearly stated in the pro EU booklet: 'This is your decision. The government will implement what you decide.'   The once in a generation decision on whether we want to be in the EU or not has already been made, we voted to leave and that must be respected either way whether or not we can get a good deal and there must be no option to stay a member in any vote on the final deal.

attributes.action: Ban the use of fireworks unless it’s a controlled and / or organised event
attributes.background: Fireworks are great but can cause unnecessary harm to both humans and animals. Fireworks are being used all year round although amazing they should be used at controlled events. Pets are often very frightened by them. A local pet slipped his lead recently and sadly passed away due to being run over
attributes.additional_details: If you know there is going to be a display you can be prepared for this but people are randomly setting fireworks off at all times of the year.   This has to stop. Also the elderly are often very anxious when hearing the loud banging and people  with dementia too.   Shops should get on board too with when they are to be sold. A government ruling needs to be actioned. The public could still be able to purchase but a ruling to say that only for Events, Firework Night and New Year etc.

attributes.action: Ban diet companies from promoting their products on social media
attributes.background:
Eating disorders are causing people all over the world to lose their lives. 

Diet companies promoting their products on social media are directly influencing young people to purchase harmful products such as ‘appetite suppressants’ - which will ultimately lead them to develop disordered eating.

attributes.action: Improve the treatment and diagnosis of Thoracic Outlet Syndrome on the NHS.
attributes.background: TOS is a condition in which the flow of blood or nerves are restricted to one or both arms. Despite the fact it creates debilitating and disabling symptoms, at present the current understanding and treatment on the NHS is very poor, often taking several years to even diagnose, if at all.
attributes.additional_details:
It can cause a range of symptoms including the pulse completely dropping from the limb as soon as it is raised, to extreme weakness and pain in the affected side. In rare cases it can even lead to blood clots and strokes.

I have personally been experiencing symptoms for 3 years, having initially been told by a doctor I was "imagining" my symptoms, which is a very common, devastating reaction faced by sufferers. The condition is serious and often requires the removal of a rib to treat.

attributes.action: Provide funding to Staffordshire County Council to reduce a £35 million deficit
attributes.background: Staffordshire County Council has already slashed running costs by £240 million in 9 years. There is a further forecast £35 million reduction that will see much needed services for Staffordshire people reduced or even removed. Therefore we are asking the UK Government to provide adequate funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are just a few of the proposed cuts: 

• School crossing patrols
• Review cost of children’s resident provision
• Review alternative autism funding
• Review of Victoria Centre of history grant 
• Removal of non-statutory community transport 
• Removal of concessionary travel before 09.30 
• Reduction in grants to voluntary community social enterprise
• Review of Adult learning disability provisions to remove preventive services
• Review remaining financial support for hate crime

attributes.action: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.background: Right for 28 days to repay prescription charges:
attributes.additional_details:
Right to 28 days to repay prescription charges:

Temporary financial difficulties happen to us all at some point in our lives, and being struck by one can be made worse when you become ill but don't qualify for financial support. I would like to propose that there be made available a 28 day period of grace for all citizens to pay prescription charges after the receipt of items. No one should be left without medical care because of a short term financial crisis. 
So those who desperately need medical help can receive it and re-pay within their next pay period.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys in children’s fast food meals.
attributes.background: Fast food restaurants produce billions of non essential plastic toys every year to give away in children’s meals. The toys which are packed in plastic bags are usually thrown away before the children even leave the restaurant.
attributes.additional_details:
Children seem to enjoy the toys more than the meals but fast food outlets could change this by offering more variety and healthier choices. They could perhaps create paper comics as an alternative to the toys and these could be recycled. 
There is too much waste in the world and too much plastic going to landfill and ending up in our oceans. Fast food outlets would make a massive difference if they cared more about the plastic waste that they produce.

attributes.action: Investigate the health impact of mobile technology on children and young people
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to examine the health impact of mobile technology on children & young people in reference to:

Sexting & Internet safety
Depression & Anxiety
General health
Sleep disorders
Technology addiction
 
Then commission an independent report
& act on its recommendations
attributes.additional_details:
Dr. Matthew M. Davis from University of Michigan Health System
https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2015-08/uomh-sai080715.php 

Smartphone Rehab article from the Independent
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/teenage-technology-addiction-smartphone-rehab-seattle-clinic-children-aged-13-mobile-devices-a7684356.html

Sonia Livingstone OBE Professor of Social Psychology (former head of dept at LSE)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SyjbDUP1o0g&vl=en

Martin Blank PHD, Columbia University
https://vimeo.com/71864167

Dr. Devra Davis, Epidemiologist & Author (The Lancet, The Journal of the American Medical Association & The New York Times)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8cJ6Il5fFg4

attributes.action: Intervene in the management of Bishop Auckland General Hospital.
attributes.background: Since Bishop Auckland General Hospital merged in to County Durham & Darlington NHS Trust, services have been lost and ward closures have become the normality. The hospital is now unable to serve the town and area.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must work with NHS Improvement to investigate these failings, and if necessary consider removing the trust’s responsibility for Bishop Auckland General Hospital.

attributes.action: Stop the ageist segregation in minimum wage. Living costs are all the same.
attributes.background: Their are four segratory categories to minimum wage. 16-17, 18-20, 21-24 and over 25. The hourly minimum difference between what a 16 year old can earn to a 25 year old is £3.63. If they were working a full time week consisting of 40 hours thats an overall anual difference of £6,969.60.
attributes.additional_details: For a 16 and 25 year old working full time, doing the same job on minimum wage their annual differential income is £6,969.60. The guardian quotes: “A single person living in Britain needs to earn at least £13,400 a year before tax to afford a basic but acceptable standard of living” however for a sixteen year old on minimum wage working 40 hours per week will earn an average anual salary of £8,064. That’s only 60.17% of what is recommended for a stable income and living.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of batons by private security staff
attributes.background: Make the use and possession of extendable batons legal for licensed security staff after completing a training course.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on HS2. Give the public the vote like we had for Brexit.
attributes.background: HS2 is expected to cost £50+billion, not to mention the mess and impact it will make on our countryside, wildlife and nature. At present our NHS, emergency services, social services, affordable housing is in disarray. We were given a referendum on Brexit which will affect us all so why not HS2?
attributes.additional_details: Having undertaken a great deal of research into the pro's & con's of this project, attended HS2 facilitated meetings, researched the impact nationally that this will bring I can't help but feel that even though Royal assent has been given its not to late to allow the public to vote on whether this project should go ahead. This country already has a good railway system which with investment can be improved using existing lines. The HS2 project is a national issue so should be decided by us all.

attributes.action: Provide annual Breast Screening and handheld mammogram machines at GP Surgeries.
attributes.background: For many years women have been offered Breast Screening every 3 years. It is a National Statistic that women have been diagnosed with Breast Cancer between Screenings and most are deemed as not 'at risk' i.e., they do not have family history. Cancer is indiscriminate and can occur between Screening.
attributes.additional_details: Recently several women who have this disease found a change in their breasts themselves, had they not, their lives would be at risk of a higher Stage of Cancer or die before their next scheduled Screening. 3 years is too long, it is the difference between life and death. Other Countries do mammograms annually logically Early Stage treatment must cost less than treatment if left. There are cheaper handheld mammogram machines which could be put in GP Surgeries so annual Screening can be supported.

attributes.action: Make teaching coping mechanisms compulsory in secondary schools
attributes.background: At 8 years-old I lost my mum to cancer, and I'd never dealt with it until 20 years later, because I wasn't equipped with adequate coping mechanisms. Children everywhere are unequipped to deal with trauma they experience on a daily basis, and the stress of later life, I'd like to change that.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 British people suffer from mental health problems, and depression is 10x more widespread than it was just a decade ago (demonstrating its alarming growth under societal changes). 85% of adults experience stress on a regular basis; a cause of anxiety, depression, panic attacks and insomnia. Suicide is the biggest cause of death in men betweeh 20 - 49. And LGBT people are more likely to experience mental health problems, and less likely to have support systems.

attributes.action: Cyclists - Make it mandatory for bicycles to have registration license plates
attributes.background: After years driving on UK roads, it is a very widely known fact that it is very difficult for cyclists to be held accountable for their traffic offences, such as running through red traffic lights and riding recklessly on pavements putting pedestrians at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/11/08/40-cyclists-jump-red-light-in-30-seconds--video/ 
https://www.ft.com/content/d430ddc2-4936-11e8-8ae9-4b5ddcca99b3

attributes.action: Make it law for all property floors to be soundproofed if above another property
attributes.background: Property in the UK, especially in London can be very close to one another. If you live beneath someone in a flat and they haven’t got efficient soundproofing it can be a nuisance even though the people above aren’t doing anything wrong.
attributes.additional_details: I lived in a property for three years where the noises from above became a constant nuisance. All they were doing was walking but it was an awful noise, especially at night when they would be awake at 1am. My anger was not directed at my neighbours but at the law not looking after people living beneath other people.

attributes.action: Keep British Summer Time (BST) all year round in UK
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST or Daylight Saving Time - DST) is 1 hour ahead of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). The UK has BST from late March to late October.  With BST there are lighter evenings, darker mornings, but lighter afternoons, greater happiness, fewer accidents and increased productivity

attributes.action: The importance of Attachment, should be taught in antenatal classes.
attributes.background: John Bowlby started his research in the 1960's - importance of a primary bond to a main person. He discovered that this role was vital in for survival, not only through infancy but long into adulthood. I struggle to understand in the 2018, this information is still not taught in antenatal classes.
attributes.additional_details: Attachments styles forms the basis of all children's relationships. The bonds that are created in the child's early life, impact the way a child develops all the way through their life. A secure attachment can create a child who is self-confident, self-resilient and has the support network to overcome barriers. An insecure attachment can affect a child in the opposite way. A child may become insecure, limited self-regulation and may struggle to form and maintain relation/friendships.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to state pension age back to 65 for men and 60 for women
attributes.background: I started paying into the N.I. system aged 16 when the retirement age was stated as 65 for men and 60 for women. I’ve been full time employed since then and have had the terms of the state pension age changed without consultation. Stand up and stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Look at the gov.uk website for the state pension change and what it means to you. You can get a personal projection so you can see how this new scheme will affect you personally.

attributes.action: Create a Dedicated Minister for Dogs (and cats)
attributes.background:
49% of UK adults own a pet. 25% of the UK adult have a cat with an estimated population of 11.1 million pet cats. 24% of the UK adult population have a dog with an estimated population of 8.9 million pet dogs.
The cost of keeping a dog each year varies by breed size £750 - £5,000
attributes.additional_details: Many services for the dog industry are not officially regulated or regulated enough. The laws are outdated, and have no consequences, yet many dogs suffer, and owners have no support if their dogs are harmed or stolen. There are various bodies and charities but each stands alone. Sweden has many forward thinking ideas which could be followed. Pet owners are often frustrated by having no voice!

attributes.action: Ensure British food standards are met in any free trade agreement with USA
attributes.background: Once 'Brexit' is complete the government will be able to seek its own Free Trade Agreements (FTAs) with other countries, most notably the USA. The USA use hormones in the rearing of their meat, Genetically Modified vegetables, and have low animal welfare requirements.
attributes.additional_details: We want all food in Britain to adhere to our standards. We do not want chicken that has been washed in chlorine, we do not want beef which has been injected with hormones, we do not want pigs who have suffered horrendous conditions to be allowed to arrive in the UK. Raising and management of animal products in this way goes against the values that the British public hold. We hold our government accountable for protecting these values.

attributes.action: Officially publicise only one title of Ms. for married and unmarried women.
attributes.background: Women must reveal their marital status on their title. This makes an issue for widows and some women who were discriminated by their title. The UK government must stop offering Mrs. & Miss as options and remove titles of Mrs. & Miss on all documents that they are responsible for.
attributes.additional_details: The title Ms. began to be used as early as the 17th century, as a title which like Mister that did not originally indicate marital status. It fell into disuse until the 20th century. What is needed today is a more comprehensive term which does homage to the sex without expressing any views as to their domestic situation. Ask the government to remove Mrs. & Miss. from official documentation, recognise and publicise Ms. functions officially as the only title both for married and unmarried women.

attributes.action: Provide more support to put an end to modern slavery in Libya
attributes.background: Last year CNN released video footage of Black African migrants being bought and sold in to slavery in Libya. The horrific events happened openly in slave auctions and migrants were being sold for as little as $400. There were also many accounts that women and girls were being sold in to sex slavery.
attributes.additional_details:
It has now been almost a year since the release of the slave auction video footage. The media's interest has significantly lessened, and public discussion has waned.

I am therefore asking the UK government to again put pressure on Libya to put an end to modern-day slavery. I am also asking the UK government to provide the public with a full and transparent update on the UK emergency interventions and UK programmes designed to specifically target Black African migrants and refugees in Libya, including a response containing details of further plans to support the complete eradication of modern slavery in the region.

https://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/14/africa/libya-migrant-auctions/index.html

attributes.action: Change the laws on buying and selling property in England and Wales
attributes.background: The government urgently need to review the laws relating to buying and selling property.Buying or selling a property is one of the most stressful experiences of any adults life.
attributes.additional_details: The current system is open to absolute abuse and gives neither the buyer or seller any security or confidence that the transaction will be completed.Should one part of the housing chain collapse, many individuals and families are caused massive distress,anxiety and financial loss.It isn't difficult to change the laws to those they follow in Scotland.This is the 21st century.The laws need to be changed now.As far as I can see the only reason changes haven't been made is because the lawyers don't want it changed.If the property sale falls through, they still get paid.

attributes.action: Increase Defence spending to at least 2.5% of GDP per year
attributes.background: If the U.K. wants to maintain its global influence, it must increase its defence budget, rather than continue to cut it.

attributes.action: Raise the max speed limit on motorways to 110 mph.
attributes.background: Due to the increasing tech of today's cars it becoming more and more unsafe to have an enforced 70 mph speed limit on UK motorways.
attributes.additional_details:
70 mph speed limits were introduced in 1965 when car wheels looked more like today's bicycle wheels. Technology has moved on unbelievable amounts in the subsequent over half a century, and is tried tested and proven to be safe at speeds exceeding 70 mph.
The mixture of the 70 mph speed limit and today's tech and ease of speed in cars erodes away at our famous British ability to maintain safe lane discipline on our motorways.

attributes.action: British students to receive U.K student loan when studying a whole degree abroad
attributes.background: I have personally been offered an incredible opportunity to study at the prestigious Design Academy Eindhoven, however I have no access to the English student loan system. So although I will be representing England as an international student I can not receive any financial support.
attributes.additional_details: Although the cost of studying internationally is lower with no access to any finance loans how can one be expected to pay outright their tuition fees and all living expenses without a loan. If British students were able to experience university in another country they would be able to bring their cultural knowledge and developed skills back to England to then pay back the student loan they borrowed from the English Government whilst in employment in the country.

attributes.action: Provide funding for mental health facilities in schools.
attributes.background:
As a young person, I feel it is my duty to break the stigma of mental health. If we can manage this problem right from the root, we can decrease suicide rates and prevent mental illnesses from progressing.
Statistics shows that mental health issues in young people have increased 6X since 1995.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been a significant increase in recent years and young people aren't reporting issues such as anxiety or depression. 

We need trained staff and support in schools; there are so many young people that need support but do not know how to speak out. Without services providing adequate support for all young people, there is absolutely no way we will be able to climb out this dark hole we currently find ourselves in.
